required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasticity of Neonatal Neuronal Networks Temporal Theta Activity, the First Endogenous
clinical_study.official_title: Plasticity of Neonatal Neuronal Networks in Very Premature Infants: Source Localization of Temporal Theta Activity, the First Endogenous Neural Biomarker, in Temporoparietal Areas

brief_summary.textblock: Temporal theta slow-wave activity (TTA-SW) in premature infants is a specific signature of the early development of temporal networks, as it is observed at the turning point between non-sensory driven spontaneous local processing and cortical network functioning. The role in development and the precise location of TTA-SW remain unknown. Previous studies have demonstrated that preterms from 28 weeks of gestational age (wGA) are able to discriminate phonemes and voice, supporting the idea of a prior genetic structural or activity-dependent fingerprint that would prepare the auditory network to compute auditory information at the onset of thalamocortical connectivity. They recorded TTA-SW in 26-32 wGA preterms. The rate of TTA-SW in response to click stimuli was evalu- ated using low-density EEG in 30 preterms. The sources of TTA-SW were localized by high-density EEG using different tissues conductivities, head models and mathematical models.

detailed_description.textblock: Temporal theta slow-wave activity (TTA-SW) in premature infants is a specific signature of the early development of temporal networks, as it is observed at the turning point between non-sensory driven spontaneous local processing and cortical network functioning. The role in development and the precise location of TTA-SW remain unknown. Previous studies have demonstrated that preterms from 28 weeks of gestational age (wGA) are able to discriminate phonemes and voice, supporting the idea of a prior genetic structural or activity-dependent fingerprint that would prepare the auditory network to compute auditory information at the onset of thalamocortical connectivity. They recorded TTA-SW in 26-32 wGA preterms. The rate of TTA-SW in response to click stimuli was evalu- ated using low-density EEG in 30 preterms.

primary_outcome.description: The objective of this study is to evaluate the spatial organization of the specific Temporal theta slow-wave activity (TTA-SW) with the Low-Density Electroencephalography (LD-EEG) at an early stage of development in humans to demonstrate that TTA-SW were independent of auditory stimuli.

arm_group.description: High-Density ElectroEncephaloGraphy analysis of 13 healthy premature infants
Low-Density ElectroEncephaloGraphy analysis of other 15 healthy premature infants

study_pop.textblock: 28 healthy premature infants follow-up between the Gestational Ages of 26 and 32 wGA between December 2014 and June 2015. These infants were divided into two groups accord- ing to age (26-30 wGA and 30-32 wGA).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy premature infants
- Gestational Ages of 26 and 32 wGA
Exclusion Criteria:
- unhealthy premature infants
